docs.title: BirdTalk Documentation
docs.text: BirdTalk is a voice-controlled iOS app that makes it easy to record bird observations in the field. Using BirdTalk, you can create and submit eBird checklists without taking your eyes off the birds.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Voice control for hands-free operation
  • Integration with eBird
  • GPS tracking
  • Bluetooth device compatibility

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
• Installation Guide: System requirements and setup instructions
  • Quick Start Guide: Essential commands for your first birding session

docs.title: User Guides
docs.text: Step-by-step instructions for common tasks like creating checklists, entering species, and using breeding codes.

docs.title: Command Reference
docs.text: Complete reference for all BirdTalk voice commands, from basic to advanced.

docs.title: Hardware Setup
docs.text: Information about compatible devices and how to set up Bluetooth accessories.

docs.title: Advanced Features
docs.text: Detailed guides for experienced users, including managing multiple checklists and location management.

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text:
• Check the Installation Troubleshooting guide for common setup issues
  • Review the Quick Start Guide for essential commands
  • For additional support, contact the developer at steve@membot.com

docs.title: About BirdTalk
docs.text: BirdTalk is developed by Steve Colwell and is currently in beta testing through TestFlight. The app is designed to enhance the birding experience by allowing birders to maintain their focus on birds while easily recording their observations.

docs.title: Installing BirdTalk
docs.text: BirdTalk is currently in beta testing and is distributed through Apple's TestFlight system. Before starting the installation process, we strongly recommend reviewing our Hardware Recommendations - while BirdTalk can be used with just your iPhone, a compatible Bluetooth headset will significantly improve your experience.

docs.title: Installation Overview
docs.text:
The installation process has several steps:

  1. Prerequisites
  2. An iPhone running iOS [version]
  3. An Apple ID account
  4. An eBird account

  5. View detailed requirements

  6. Beta Access

  7. Request access to the BirdTalk beta
  8. You'll need to provide the email address associated with your Apple ID

  9. The developer will add you as a beta tester

  10. TestFlight Setup

  11. Install TestFlight from the App Store
  12. Accept the beta invitation
  13. Install BirdTalk through TestFlight

  14. Step-by-step installation guide

  15. Initial Configuration

  16. Enter your eBird account credentials
  17. Complete API setup (via developer)
  18. Run initial tests
  19. Configuration guide

For detailed installation instructions, follow our setup guide. If you encounter any issues during installation, check our troubleshooting guide or contact the developer.

docs.title: Hardware
docs.text:
• iPhone 6s or newer
  • iOS 15.0 or later
  • At least 100MB of free storage space

docs.title: Accounts
docs.text:
• Apple ID
  • eBird account
  • If you don't have an eBird account, you can create one at eBird.org
  • Your eBird account must be fully set up and validated

docs.title: Internet Connectivity
docs.text:
• Internet connection required for:
  • Initial installation
  • Downloading regional bird data
  • Submitting checklists
  • Can operate offline in the field once initial setup is complete

docs.title: Recommended Equipment
docs.text: While not required, we strongly recommend: - OpenComm2 Bone Conduction Stereo Bluetooth Headset by Shokz - See our Hardware Recommendations for details - Sufficient battery power for extended field sessions - Consider a portable battery pack for long birding trips

docs.title: Location Services
docs.text:
• GPS capabilities used for:
  • Automatic hotspot detection
  • Track recording
  • Location stamping of observations
  • Location Services must be enabled for full functionality

docs.title: Bluetooth
docs.text:
• Required only if using a Bluetooth headset
  • Bluetooth 4.0 or later recommended

docs.title: Getting Beta Access
docs.text:
1. Email your request for beta access to steve@membot.com
  2. Include the email address you use to log in to your Apple ID account
  3. Wait for confirmation that you've been added as a beta tester

docs.title: Installing TestFlight
docs.text:
1. Open the App Store on your iPhone
  2. Search for "TestFlight"
  3. Download and install the TestFlight app
  4. Sign in with your Apple ID when prompted

docs.title: Installing BirdTalk
docs.text:
1. Open TestFlight
  2. You should see BirdTalk listed as an available beta app
  3. Tap "Install" next to BirdTalk
  4. Wait for the installation to complete

docs.title: Initial Setup
docs.text:
1. Open BirdTalk
  2. When prompted, enter your eBird account credentials:
  3. Email address
  4. Password
  5. Contact the developer to let them know you've completed the installation
  6. You'll receive a text message with additional configuration information
  7. Click the link in the text message to complete the API setup

docs.title: Verifying Installation
docs.text:
1. Start BirdTalk
  2. Say "Time" to test voice recognition
  3. If you're using a Bluetooth headset, say "Switch" to test audio switching
  4. Try creating a test checklist (see First Session Guide)

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Review the Quick Start Guide
  • Set up your recommended hardware
  • Try the basic commands tutorial

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text: If you encounter any issues during installation: 1. Check our troubleshooting guide 2. Make sure you've completed all steps in order 3. Contact the developer at steve@membot.com

docs.title: TestFlight Problems
docs.text:
• TestFlight shows "No Apps Available"
  • Verify you're signed in with the correct Apple ID
  • Check that the developer has added you as a beta tester

  • Try signing out and back in to TestFlight

  • Can't Install TestFlight

  • Verify iOS version meets minimum requirements
  • Check available storage space
  • Try restarting your iPhone

docs.title: BirdTalk Installation
docs.text:
• BirdTalk won't install
  • Ensure you have sufficient storage space
  • Check your internet connection
  • Delete and reinstall TestFlight
  • Contact the developer for new beta access if needed

docs.title: eBird Authentication
docs.text:
• Can't log in to eBird
  • Verify your eBird credentials
  • Check internet connection
  • Ensure your eBird account is active
  • Try resetting your eBird password

docs.title: API Configuration
docs.text:
• Didn't receive configuration text
  • Contact the developer
  • Verify your phone number is correct

  • Check if text messages are blocked

  • Configuration link doesn't work

  • Try copying and pasting the link
  • Request a new configuration link
  • Check if you're running the latest version

docs.title: Command Recognition
docs.text:
• BirdTalk doesn't respond to commands
  • Check microphone permissions
  • Verify the correct audio input is selected
  • Try the "Switch" command to change inputs
  • Speak more clearly and slightly louder

docs.title: Audio Problems
docs.text:
• Can't hear BirdTalk responses
  • Check volume settings
  • Verify audio output selection
  • Try the "Switch" command
  • Restart the app

docs.title: Connection Problems
docs.text:
• Headset won't connect
  • Ensure Bluetooth is enabled
  • Try forgetting and re-pairing the device
  • Restart both the headset and iPhone
  • Check headset battery level

docs.title: Audio Switching
docs.text:
• Audio using wrong output
  • Use the "Switch" command
  • Disconnect other Bluetooth devices
  • Turn headset off and on
  • Restart BirdTalk

docs.title: General Troubleshooting Steps
docs.text:
1. Basic Steps
  2. Close and reopen BirdTalk
  3. Restart your iPhone
  4. Check for TestFlight updates

  5. Verify internet connection

  6. Reset Steps

  7. Sign out and back in to eBird
  8. Reinstall BirdTalk through TestFlight
  9. Reset Bluetooth settings

  10. Request new API configuration

  11. If Problems Persist

  12. Document the specific issue
  13. Note any error messages
  14. Record steps to reproduce the problem
  15. Contact the developer with details

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text: If you continue to experience issues: - Email steve@membot.com - Include your iPhone model and iOS version - Describe the specific problem and steps to reproduce - Mention any error messages you see
